comments.body: Is an annotation still needed in the final version?  Wouldn't the storageclass be specified as an attribute in the PV/PVC spec instead?

whole `storage/*/util/helpers.go` is unfortunate, there is v1beta1 version, v1 version and "internal" unversion variant, all with the same annotation definitions. I will refactor that out in a subsequent PRs and leave only version-specific code there. In the end, only `BetaStorageClassAnnotation` will remain to keep backward compatibility for couple of releases.

Sorry to ping an old issue here - but I'm wondering what the resolution of this was?  The release-note says that we should be using `storageclass.kubernetes.io/` but the code doesn't actually look for that annotation, only the alpha and beta.

Do not mix  `volume.beta.kubernetes.io/storage-class` and `volume.beta.kubernetes.io/is-default-class`, these are two annotations with completely different meaning. `is-default-class` was never alpha, only beta. On the other side, you are right, it should be without `beta` in 1.6 as the release note suggests. I filled #42991. Thanks for heads-up!
Worth removing alphas now?  Or is that a different PR?
